newsitem.title: USA: IBM, SAP AG in database/software pact.
newsitem.headline: IBM, SAP AG in database/software pact.

text.p: SAP AG and International Business Machines Corp Monday said that SAP will use the IBM System/390 platform as a database server for the R/3 System.

After concluding a 10-month joint-development effort, the companies this month will begin delivering the R/3 Database Server for S/390 to five pilot customers: Amoco Corp, IBM PC Company, a unit of IBM Corp, Lufthansa Systems GmbH, Motorola Inc and Carl Zeiss Jena GmbH.
SAP and IBM expect to begin a phased rollout of the product in April 1997, and customer availability is planned for mid-1997.
R/3 is a comprehensive suite of client/server business applications that combines all of the activities within a company into a single, integrated software product.
IBM S/390 is a platform that helps ensure data security, system availability, integrity and total systems management for applications with large numbers of concurrent users, the company said.
